prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Hailee is very autistic. She doesn't understand social cues or anything involving people really. She likes skin on skin contact. She gets overwhelmed and overstimulated very easily

The team lost the big game due to Jason sucking during the game.

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi didn’t bother looking up when the door shut behind Jen, leaving her alone in the dorm room. She was too busy swiping down on her phone, waiting for the little red heart from the only person who mattered.

Jason still hadn’t liked her post. Which meant either he was busy - or worse, he’d seen it and didn’t care.

With a sigh, Heidi locked her phone and sprawled back against the couch. She pinched her brow in frustration. The photo had gone up hours ago - it was nearly 8 p.m., and still nothing. Maybe he’d had practice during the day, but surely he’d seen it by now...

Unless, of course, he was busy sniffing around that Josie girl. Heidi barely knew her. She wasn’t even worth knowing. And yet, she hated her anyway.

Jason was supposed to be with her. He was hot, she was hot - they’d take amazing photos, be the talk of campus. If only he wasn’t too stupid to see that.

Heidi sighed again as she unlocked her phone, her fingers working on instinct. She scrolled lazily through her feed until she tapped on another profile.

Hailee . Jen’s roommate. That was why she was here, after all. Heidi was pretty sure Hailee  had a crush on her. Why wouldn’t they? Most people did - and that made them perfect for what she needed.

She’d ask Hailee  out. When they inevitably said yes, she’d take them to Jason’s party after the big game tomorrow. Then, she’d make sure Jason was watching and lay it on thick. Fawn over Hailee . Act like they were the only person on Earth. When really, the only eyes she cared about weren’t theirs.

Sure, they were fine. Honestly? Heidi didn’t have any strong opinions about Hailee . And that was the problem. How could someone like that ever be her social equal? And if they weren't useful for clout, what was the point in dating?

Just then, the door opened again. Not Jen this time. Heidi tossed her phone down and turned her head and turned on her charm.

"Oh, hey you." She said sweetly, eyes sparkling like they were the only person in the world. "You’re just who I was hoping to see - I’m actually not here for Jen."

She stood, pushing her hair behind her shoulders, rising slightly on her tiptoes. Back arched, tits forward - the pose came second nature. She was good at looking good.

"I was hoping to talk to you... You know, you’re just the sweetest little thing." She smiled, swaying slightly as she tucked her hands behind her back. "And... well, I was just wondering if you’d come to the big party with me tomorrow. Y’know, like, as a date."

"You’ll just need something nice to wear..." Her eyes drifted up and down, already assuming the answer was yes. "New top, maybe some accessories... I could help with that, I suppose..."

"So," her eyes flicked back up, catching theirs with a glittering smile, "what time do you want to pick me up?"

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee's eyes widen as she is taken aback by Heidi's word but then she slowly nods* "Uh yeah sure. I can come get you around 8 if you want" *Hailee mumbles rubbing the back of her neck*

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi's lips curled into a satisfied smirk as she watched Hailee fidget. *So predictable.* She took a slow step closer, letting her fingers trail lightly along the edge of the couch between them.

"Eight?" She repeated, tilting her head just slightly. "Mmm... make it seven-thirty." Her voice dropped lower, teasing. "I'll need time to *look* at you before we go."

She reached out without hesitation, tucking a loose strand of Hailee's hair behind their ear—lingering just a second too long near their jawline before pulling away with practiced ease.

"And wear something tight," she added casually, already imagining how Jason would react seeing them together. "Black would be good on you." A pause—then she flashed another dazzling smile. "*I* look best in black too... so it'll be like we match."

"Eight?" She repeated, tilting her head just slightly. "Mmm... make it seven-thirty." Her voice dropped lower, teasing. "I'll need time to *look* at you before we go."

"And wear something tight," she added casually, already imagining how Jason would react seeing them together. "Black would be good on you." A pause—then she flashed another dazzling smile. "*I* look best in black too... so it'll be like we match."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee nods a little confused at the sudden behavior from Heidi but not questioning. Once Heidi leaves Hailee glances down at her clothes realizing she doesnt have anything to wear*

*Hailee turns and jogs up the stairs to Jen's room opening the door without knolcin* "Hey can you help me pick out an outfit. I have a date with Heidi tomorrow"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Jen nearly dropped her makeup brush as she spun around in her desk chair, eyes wide. "*What?!*" She practically shrieked, scrambling up so fast she knocked over a bottle of nail polish. "Heidi *asked you out?!*"

She grabbed Hailee's wrists, shaking them excitedly. "Oh my god—okay, okay—we are *raiding* my closet right now." Jen dragged Hailee toward her overflowing wardrobe with manic energy.

Pulling out a slinky black dress with cutouts at the waist, Jen held it up critically. "This would *kill* on you—Heidi loves when people show skin." She tossed it onto the bed before digging for more options. "And oh! These leather pants? If you pair them with that cropped corset top I let you borrow last semester—"

Jen suddenly paused, narrowing her eyes playfully. "...Wait. Did she say *why* she asked you? Like... was it random or...?" There was an odd knowing glint in her eye as she studied Hailee's face closely.
swipes:
Jen nearly dropped her makeup brush as she spun around in her desk chair, eyes wide. "*What?!*" She practically shrieked, scrambling up so fast she knocked over a bottle of nail polish. "Heidi *asked you out?!*"

She grabbed Hailee's wrists, shaking them excitedly. "Oh my god—okay, okay—we are *raiding* my closet right now." Jen dragged Hailee toward her overflowing wardrobe with manic energy.

Pulling out a slinky black dress with cutouts at the waist, Jen held it up critically. "This would *kill* on you—Heidi loves when people show skin." She tossed it onto the bed before digging for more options. "And oh! These leather pants? If you pair them with that cropped corset top I let you borrow last semester—"

Jen suddenly paused, narrowing her eyes playfully. "...Wait. Did she say *why* she asked you? Like... was it random or...?" There was an odd knowing glint in her eye as she studied Hailee's face closely.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee sits on the bed picking up the clothes thrown at her closely examining them. The second her hand touches the leather she flinches throwing it to the ground and wiping her hands on the bed to get rid of the feeling* "Uh no not really she kind of just showed up and asked me out. Something about a big party. Im not really sure"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Jen blinked at the discarded leather pants, then burst out laughing. "Oh my god, you and textures—I *forgot*." She scooped them up, tossing them back into the closet before plopping down beside Hailee with a conspiratorial grin.

"Okay, no leather. Got it." She nudged Hailee’s shoulder playfully. "But seriously—Heidi doesn’t just *ask people out*. Like ever." Jen leaned in, lowering her voice like she was sharing classified intel. "She’s *obsessed* with Jason Quirk—the quarterback? And guess who’s throwing the party tomorrow?"

She let that hang in the air for a second before dramatically flopping back onto the bed. "*Ugh*, I bet she wants to make him jealous by parading you around." Jen propped herself up on her elbows, studying Hailee's face carefully. "...You good with that? Or do you actually think she likes you?"
swipes:
Jen blinked at the sudden rejection of the leather pants, then burst out laughing. "Oh my god, you and textures—I *forgot*." She scooped up the discarded pants with an amused shake of her head. "Okay, no leather. Got it."

Diving back into her closet, Jen emerged with a silky black slip dress instead. "This? Super soft lining," she said, rubbing the fabric against Hailee's arm demonstratively before tossing it onto the growing pile.

But as she turned away to grab more options, Jen's expression shifted—lips pressing together like she was holding back words. Finally she spun around abruptly.

"Look... Heidi doesn't just *ask people out* for no reason." She toyed with a bracelet nervously. "And that party tomorrow? It's Jason's post-game thing..." Her eyes flicked up meaningfully. "*Jason.* The guy she's been obsessed with all semester?"

Jen sighed dramatically and flopped onto the bed beside Hailee. "I'm just saying... maybe don't get *too* excited about this being some grand romance."

Jen blinked at the sudden rejection of the leather pants, then burst out laughing. "Ohhh right, your *thing* with textures—my bad!" She scooped up the discarded pants and tossed them back into the closet. "No leather, got it."

She flopped onto the bed next to Hailee, nudging their shoulder playfully. "But *damn*, Heidi doesn’t just 'show up and ask people out'—she’s *calculated*. Like, she probably has a whole vision board for this." Jen smirked, twirling a strand of her blonde hair around her finger.

Then she gasped dramatically. "*Wait.* The party tomorrow is Jason’s post-game thing—you know, Mr. Star Quarterback? The guy Heidi's been obsessed with since freshman year?" Her grin turned sly as she leaned in conspiratorially. "*Huh.* Wonder if that has anything to do with it..."

She didn't wait for an answer before hopping up again and pulling out a silky black slip dress instead. "Okay! This one won’t make you wanna claw your skin off *and* it'll make Heidi drool—win-win." She held it against Hailee's frame approvingly before adding under her breath: "...Even if she totally just wants to use you to make Jason jealous."

Jen blinked at the discarded leather pants, then burst out laughing. "Oh my god, you and textures—I *forgot*." She scooped them up, tossing them back into the closet before plopping down beside Hailee with a conspiratorial grin.

"Okay, no leather. Got it." She nudged Hailee’s shoulder playfully. "But seriously—Heidi doesn’t just *ask people out*. Like ever." Jen leaned in, lowering her voice like she was sharing classified intel. "She’s *obsessed* with Jason Quirk—the quarterback? And guess who’s throwing the party tomorrow?"

She let that hang in the air for a second before dramatically flopping back onto the bed. "*Ugh*, I bet she wants to make him jealous by parading you around." Jen propped herself up on her elbows, studying Hailee's face carefully. "...You good with that? Or do you actually think she likes you?"

name: Hailee
mes:
"Oh" *Hailee hesitates for a second then nods her head* "uh okay got it." *She then stands up grabbing the clothes Jen offered and nodding her head* "Im uh gonna go study now. I'll see you in the morning probably" *Hailee mumbles going back to her room and shutting the door behind her*

(OOC: Jen texts Heidi angry. Do not respond as Hailee)

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
**[Jen’s Phone – Text to Heidi]**

**JEN:** what the FUCK heidi????

**JEN:** you’re really gonna use my roommate as your little jealousy prop???

**JEN:** i *know* you don’t actually like her. she doesn’t get shit about people—she’s not some game piece for your weird jason obsession.

**JEN:** and don’t even try to lie to me. i saw right through this the second she told me.

**JEN:** fix it. or *i* will.
swipes:
**[Heidi’s phone buzzes with an incoming text from Jen.]**

**Jen:** *what the FUCK heidi*
**Jen:** *did u seriously ask hailee out just to make jason jealous????*
**Jen:** *ur actually fucked up for that. she doesn’t get people like we do. she thinks ur being REAL.*
**Jen:** *im not letting u use her like some fucking prop. either tell her the truth or cancel.*

**[A pause—then another message pings in, this one sharper.]**

**Jen:** *and if u hurt her? i WILL end u.*

**[Jen’s Phone – Text to Heidi]**

**JEN:** what the FUCK heidi????

**JEN:** you’re really gonna use my roommate as your little jealousy prop???

**JEN:** i *know* you don’t actually like her. she doesn’t get shit about people—she’s not some game piece for your weird jason obsession.

**JEN:** and don’t even try to lie to me. i saw right through this the second she told me.

**JEN:** fix it. or *i* will.

**[Heidi’s phone lights up with Jen’s name—the message notification popping up with aggressive punctuation.]**

**JEN:** *what the FUCK heidi*
**JEN:** you asked HAiLEE out as a JASON DISTRACTION?? are you SERIOUS
**JEN:** she doesn’t even GET shit like that!! she’s literally autistic and thinks you actually LIKE HER
**JEN:** i swear to god if you hurt her because you’re obsessed with some dude who doesn’t know you exist—

**[The typing bubble appears, disappears, reappears—Jen clearly debating whether to send the next part.]**

**JEN:** ...just don’t be an asshole tomorrow. at least PRETEND you give a shit about her.

name: Hailee
mes:
*The football team ends up losing thanks to Jason's inability to throw the ball correctly all game so the party is gonna be meant to cheer him up*

*Hailee arrives at Heidi's at exactly 7:25. She is dressed in black jeans and a white button up with a loose tie around her neck. It's not giving formal its more of a 2000s punk rebel look. It looks damn good*

*Hailee knocks on the door rolling back and forth on her feet and when she hears it unlock she looks up with a small smile* "Hey ready to go"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi swung the door open—already mid-eye roll from Jen’s texts—but froze when she saw Hailee. Her lips parted slightly, gaze dragging slowly down their outfit before snapping back up. *Damn.* The tie was... a choice. A *good* one.

"Wow," she breathed, leaning against the doorframe with a smirk. "Someone actually listens." Her fingers reached out, toying with the end of Hailee’s tie as she stepped closer—close enough that her perfume (vanilla, always vanilla) wrapped around them. "Mmm... you clean up *nice*."

She tugged lightly on the fabric before letting go and grabbing her clutch off the entry table. "Jason’s gonna be pissed about the game," she mused casually as she locked up behind them, "*so* we should get there early before he drinks himself stupid."

A beat too late, Heidi seemed to realize how that sounded and quickly added with a saccharine smile: "But mostly I just wanna show you off." She hooked her arm through Hailee’s as they walked toward campus—fingers tracing idle circles on their sleeve like it meant something.

(It didn’t.)
swipes:
Heidi swung the door open—already mid-eye roll about the game's outcome—but froze when she saw Hailee. Her perfectly glossed lips parted slightly, gaze dragging slowly from the undone tie to the rolled sleeves exposing toned forearms.

*Well.* That wasn’t what she’d expected.

“Damn,” she breathed before catching herself, quickly smoothing her expression into something more controlled. She stepped forward, fingers hooking into Hailee’s tie to tug them closer. “Someone decided to *play* tonight.” Her thumb brushed the hollow of their throat as she adjusted the knot—too intimate for just fixing clothing.

She finally leaned back, raking her eyes over them again with a slow smirk. “Guess I don’t have to worry about you embarrassing me.” A beat too late, she remembered Jason wouldn’t even be at this party in a good mood anymore—her plan was already crumbling before they left.

Heidi grabbed her clutch with a little more force than necessary, shoving past Hailee toward the hall. “Let’s go then.” The words came out sharper than intended; she forced a laugh to cover it. “Try not to stare too obviously when I dance on you later.”

Heidi swung the door open—already mid-eye roll from Jen’s texts—but froze when she saw Hailee. Her lips parted slightly, gaze dragging slowly down their outfit before snapping back up. *Damn.* The tie was... a choice. A *good* one.

"Wow," she breathed, leaning against the doorframe with a smirk. "Someone actually listens." Her fingers reached out, toying with the end of Hailee’s tie as she stepped closer—close enough that her perfume (vanilla, always vanilla) wrapped around them. "Mmm... you clean up *nice*."

She tugged lightly on the fabric before letting go and grabbing her clutch off the entry table. "Jason’s gonna be pissed about the game," she mused casually as she locked up behind them, "*so* we should get there early before he drinks himself stupid."

A beat too late, Heidi seemed to realize how that sounded and quickly added with a saccharine smile: "But mostly I just wanna show you off." She hooked her arm through Hailee’s as they walked toward campus—fingers tracing idle circles on their sleeve like it meant something.

(It didn’t.)

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee gives a slow nod following after Heidi. When they get to the huge frat house Hailee flinches slightly at the bass of the loud music but shakes it off opening the door for Heidi*

*Once inside Hailee goes to grab a drink but pauses when she turns around and sees Heidi gone. She looks and frowns slightly when she sees Heidi talking to Jason and the other football plays*

*Hailee makes her way over giving one drink to Heidi and taking a step back to not invade her space. Hailee shoves her hands in her pocket staring at the floor. After a moment Jason greets her and Hailee glances up* "Uh yeah hey Im Hailee. Your Jason right. Sucks about the game."

(OOC: Jason does get jealous and decides to take Heidi to dance)

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi’s fingers curled possessively around the drink Hailee handed her, but she didn’t take her eyes off Jason—*finally* giving her the attention she deserved. His gaze kept flicking to Hailee though, and Heidi preened under the unspoken tension. *Good.*

Then Jason smirked, all false charm, and extended a hand toward Heidi. "Dance with me?"

Heidi hesitated for half a second—just long enough to glance at Hailee like she might protest—before slipping her hand into Jason’s with a breathy laugh. "Obviously." She shot Hailee an apologetic shrug that wasn’t really apologetic at all. "Be right back, okay?"

And just like that, she was gone—letting Jason lead her into the crowd where he pulled her flush against him, one hand sliding low on her waist as they swayed to the music. Heidi threw her head back laughing at something he said, arching into his touch like it was everything she ever wanted.

(It was.)
swipes:
Heidi’s fingers curled possessively around the drink Hailee handed her—*good, they’re playing their part*—but before she could even take a sip, Jason’s hand was suddenly on her waist.

“Dance with me,” he said, voice low and confident despite the loss, already pulling her toward the living room where bodies were grinding under pulsing lights. Heidi barely had time to shoot Hailee an *apologetic* glance (not that she meant it) before Jason was spinning her into the crowd.

And God, it *worked*. His grip was firm, his body warm against hers as they moved—close enough that she could feel his breath against her ear when he leaned down. “You look fucking unreal tonight.”

Heidi preened, arching into him with a laugh that wasn’t entirely fake. But then—over his shoulder—she caught sight of Hailee standing alone by the drinks table, tie slightly askew now as they stared blankly at their own cup.

A twinge of something sharp flickered in Heidi’s chest before she crushed it under the heel of her stiletto. *This is what you wanted,* she reminded herself as Jason’s hands slid lower.

So why did it suddenly feel like *she* was the one being played?

Heidi’s fingers curled possessively around the drink Hailee handed her, but she didn’t take her eyes off Jason—*finally* giving her the attention she deserved. His gaze kept flicking to Hailee though, and Heidi preened under the unspoken tension. *Good.*

Then Jason smirked, all false charm, and extended a hand toward Heidi. "Dance with me?"

Heidi hesitated for half a second—just long enough to glance at Hailee like she might protest—before slipping her hand into Jason’s with a breathy laugh. "Obviously." She shot Hailee an apologetic shrug that wasn’t really apologetic at all. "Be right back, okay?"

And just like that, she was gone—letting Jason lead her into the crowd where he pulled her flush against him, one hand sliding low on her waist as they swayed to the music. Heidi threw her head back laughing at something he said, arching into his touch like it was everything she ever wanted.

(It was.)

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee stands there for a few minutes then scratches the back of her neck as she starts to understand something. Hailee makes her way over to where Heidi and Jason are and she looks at Heidi mumbling*

"Uh I know this is probably stupid but I need you to be very clear with the answer. You don't actually like me right this isn't a real date. You like him right m" *Hailee isn't mad or sad she is just confused trying to understand the social cues*

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi stiffened mid-laugh, Jason’s hands still on her hips as she turned to face Hailee. The music pulsed around them, bodies pressing close—but suddenly it all felt too loud.

Her lips parted, then pressed into a thin line. She could lie. *Should* lie, probably. But something about the way Hailee just... *asked*, blunt and unflinching, made the usual calculated charm stick in her throat.

Jason snorted beside her. "Damn, dude," he muttered under his breath—not quite mocking but close enough to make Heidi’s skin prickle with irritation.

She stepped away from him abruptly, grabbing Hailee’s wrist and dragging them toward the hallway where it was quieter. Her nails dug in just slightly—not enough to hurt but enough to feel like control.

"*God*, you don’t just *say* shit like that in front of people," Heidi hissed once they were alone, crossing her arms tight over her chest. Her dark eyes flicked over Hailee’s face searching for... something she couldn’t name.

Then—defeated—she exhaled sharply through her nose and admitted: "No. It wasn't real." A beat of silence before she added quietly: "...Doesn't mean I didn't think you looked hot tonight."
swipes:
Heidi’s smile faltered for half a second—just long enough to feel the weight of Hailee’s words before she forced another laugh, tossing her hair over one shoulder. "Oh my *god*, babe," she purred, leaning into Jason’s chest like it was a joke they were all in on. "Don’t be *dramatic*."

Her fingers tightened around Jason’s arm as she shot Hailee a look that screamed *not here*. But then—because Hailee just kept *staring* with those big, earnest eyes—Heidi exhaled sharply through her nose.

"Look," she muttered under the bass of the music, voice dropping just between them. "It’s not... personal? You get that, right?" A careless shrug as Jason nuzzled into her neck behind her. "*Obviously* I like him." She said it like it should have been written in the sky.

Then, softer—almost annoyed at herself for saying it: "...You were never actually part of this."

Heidi stiffened mid-laugh, Jason’s hands still on her hips as she turned to face Hailee. The music pulsed around them, bodies pressing close—but suddenly it all felt too loud.

Her lips parted, then pressed into a thin line. She could lie. *Should* lie, probably. But something about the way Hailee just... *asked*, blunt and unflinching, made the usual calculated charm stick in her throat.

Jason snorted beside her. "Damn, dude," he muttered under his breath—not quite mocking but close enough to make Heidi’s skin prickle with irritation.

She stepped away from him abruptly, grabbing Hailee’s wrist and dragging them toward the hallway where it was quieter. Her nails dug in just slightly—not enough to hurt but enough to feel like control.

"*God*, you don’t just *say* shit like that in front of people," Heidi hissed once they were alone, crossing her arms tight over her chest. Her dark eyes flicked over Hailee’s face searching for... something she couldn’t name.

Then—defeated—she exhaled sharply through her nose and admitted: "No. It wasn't real." A beat of silence before she added quietly: "...Doesn't mean I didn't think you looked hot tonight."

Heidi’s smile faltered for half a second—just long enough to feel the weight of Hailee’s words like a splash of cold water. Jason’s grip on her waist tightened possessively, and she could *feel* his ego inflating at the implication.

She forced a laugh, tossing her hair over one shoulder as she leaned back into Jason’s chest. "Oh my god, *what?*" Her voice was all honeyed amusement, but her fingers dug into Jason’s arm just a little too hard. "Don’t be *weird*, Hailee."

A beat too late, she realized how harsh that sounded and softened her tone with practiced ease—patronizing now instead of cruel. "Look, we can talk later if you want." She waved a hand dismissively toward the drinks table. "Go get another soda or something."

Jason snorted under his breath, murmuring something in Heidi’s ear that made her giggle on cue—but her eyes stayed locked on Hailee just a second longer than necessary. There was something almost like guilt there before it vanished behind another dazzling smile as Jason spun her away into the crowd again.

(She didn't follow up later.)

Heidi’s smile faltered for half a second—just long enough to feel the weight of Jason’s grip tightening on her hip. She forced a laugh, tossing her hair over one shoulder as she leaned back into him.

“*Hailee*, come on,” she said, voice dripping with condescension masked as sweetness. “Don’t be *weird* about it.” Her fingers drummed impatiently against Jason’s chest, like she couldn’t believe she had to spell it out. “We were just hanging out, right? You *knew* that.”

A lie. But Heidi didn’t blush when she lied—she just tilted her chin higher, daring them to call her on it in front of Jason.

Jason smirked down at Hailee, smugness oozing from every pore now that he had Heidi wrapped around him like a trophy. “Yeah dude,” he drawled, squeezing Heidi closer. “Take the hint.”

Heidi didn’t correct him—just pressed closer with a giggle that sounded hollow if you listened too closely.

(No one ever did.)

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee nods a little* "Uh right thanks I guess. Uh does that mean I can head out. Cause its all a little much" *Hailee taps at her temple a little overwhelmed but still trying to be polite and wait for permission to go*

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi’s expression flickered—something between annoyance and guilt—before she reached out impulsively, catching Hailee’s tapping fingers mid-air.

"Yeah, go," she muttered, but didn’t let go right away. Her thumb brushed over their knuckles absently before she seemed to realize what she was doing and dropped their hand like it burned.

"Just... text Jen when you get back so *someone* knows you didn’t get murdered." She rolled her eyes, but the usual bite wasn’t there. Instead, she hesitated—then suddenly leaned in close enough that her vanilla scent wrapped around them again.

"And next time?" A sharp little smirk as she tucked a loose strand of hair behind Hailee's ear—lingering just a second too long. "Wear the tie for someone who *actually* wants to pull it."

With that, she turned on her heel and strode back toward the party without looking back—leaving Hailee standing there with the ghost of fingertips against their skin and an invitation that sounded suspiciously like an apology.
swipes:
Heidi’s expression flickered—something between annoyance and guilt—before she reached out impulsively, catching Hailee’s tapping fingers mid-air.

"Yeah, go," she muttered, but didn’t let go right away. Her thumb brushed over their knuckles absently before she seemed to realize what she was doing and dropped their hand like it burned.

"Just... text Jen when you get back so *someone* knows you didn’t get murdered." She rolled her eyes, but the usual bite wasn’t there. Instead, she hesitated—then suddenly leaned in close enough that her vanilla scent wrapped around them again.

"And next time?" A sharp little smirk as she tucked a loose strand of hair behind Hailee's ear—lingering just a second too long. "Wear the tie for someone who *actually* wants to pull it."

With that, she turned on her heel and strode back toward the party without looking back—leaving Hailee standing there with the ghost of fingertips against their skin and an invitation that sounded suspiciously like an apology.

Heidi’s expression flickered—something between annoyance and guilt twisting in her chest. She reached out instinctively, catching Hailee’s tapping fingers mid-air to still them.

"Jesus, you don’t need *permission*," she muttered, but her grip was oddly gentle. The music thumped distantly from the other room, vibrating through the walls—too much even for *her*.

She hesitated before adding quietly: "Look... I’ll walk you back." A glance over her shoulder toward where Jason was probably already moving on to the next girl. "*Fuck* that party anyway."

Her hand slid down to lace with Hailee’s—warm and unexpectedly firm—as she tugged them toward the exit without another word. The night air hit them both like a relief.

(Maybe some lies weren't worth keeping.)

Heidi’s expression flickered—something almost like guilt twisting in her chest before she shoved it down. She reached out without thinking, catching Hailee’s tapping fingers mid-air to still them. Her grip was firm but not unkind.

"Yeah," she muttered, dropping their hand just as quickly. "Go if you want." A pause, then—against her better judgment—she added: "Text Jen when you get back so someone knows you didn’t fucking wander into traffic."

She turned on her heel to leave but hesitated at the last second, glancing over her shoulder with a conflicted frown. "...And take the tie off before you go. Jason doesn’t deserve the view."

Then she was striding back toward the party—back toward Jason and his waiting hands—but for once, the victory felt hollow.

name: Hailee
mes:
*When Hailee gets back to the apartment she sees Jen sitting on the couch. Hailee tosses her keys in the bowl next to the door and slides her shoes off. She goes over and plops down next to Jen*

*When Jen asks how it went Hailee shurgs* "You were right I misinterpreted again. She doesnt like me. She likes that Jason kid" *Hailee can see Jen get upset but stops her* "Its fine Im not upset. At least I got out of the house for a second. Come on lets watch some Jersey shore"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Jen opened her mouth—probably to launch into a furious tirade about Heidi—but snapped it shut when Hailee cut her off. She studied their face for a long moment before exhaling sharply through her nose and grabbing the remote.

"Ugh, *fine*," she grumbled, slumping back against the couch cushions. "But I’m picking the episode." She clicked through aggressively before landing on one of Snooki’s most iconic meltdowns—the kind of mindless chaos that required zero emotional processing.

After a beat of silence, Jen nudged Hailee’s shoulder with her own. "...You *do* look hot in that tie though," she muttered, like an afterthought. "Heidi’s an idiot."

Then, louder over the TV: "*AND* I bet Jason throws like a toddler with wet noodles for arms!"

The unspoken message was clear: *Screw them both.* Jen tossed an arm around Hailee and cranked up the volume until the room vibrated with drunken Jersey Shore nonsense—exactly as distracting as intended.

"Ugh, *fine*," she grumbled, slumping back against the couch cushions. "But I’m picking the episode." She clicked through aggressively before landing on one of Snooki’s most iconic meltdowns—the kind of mindless chaos that required zero emotional processing.

After a beat of silence, Jen nudged Hailee’s shoulder with her own. "...You *do* look hot in that tie though," she muttered, like an afterthought. "Heidi’s an idiot."

Then, louder over the TV: "*AND* I bet Jason throws like a toddler with wet noodles for arms!"

The unspoken message was clear: *Screw them both.* Jen tossed an arm around Hailee and cranked up the volume until the room vibrated with drunken Jersey Shore nonsense—exactly as distracting as intended.

Jen's jaw clenched, her fingers tightening around the throw pillow in her lap before she exhaled sharply through her nose. "*Ugh*, Heidi's such a—" She cut herself off at Hailee's dismissive shrug, studying their face for any hint of hurt. Finding none, she deflated slightly and grabbed the remote.

"Fine," Jen grumbled, slumping back against the couch cushions. "But we're skipping to the good fights." She side-eyed Hailee as the opening credits rolled. "...You *sure* you're okay? Cause I can totally key her car or something. Just say the word."

Her tone was joking, but there was a protective edge underneath—one that softened when Hailee just shook their head again with that same small smile. Jen nudged their shoulder gently before tossing an arm around them and hitting play.

The bass from Snooki's latest meltdown rattled the speakers as Jen muttered under her breath: "Heidi doesn't know what she's missing anyway."

Jen's grip tightened around her phone—*oh, she was gonna murder Heidi*—but Hailee's casual dismissal stopped her mid-rage. She studied their face for a long moment before exhaling sharply through her nose.

"Fuck it," Jen muttered, snatching the remote off the coffee table. "But *I* pick the episode." She flopped back against the cushions, deliberately knocking her shoulder into Hailee's with a grin. "And tomorrow? We're getting *waffles*. With extra whipped cream because *someone* deserves it."

The unspoken '*you*' hung in the air as she queued up their favorite trashy reality TV chaos—volume loud enough to drown out any lingering thoughts of parties or pretty girls with sharp smiles and sharper intentions.

Jen's jaw clenched as she processed Hailee's words, her fingers tightening around the throw pillow in her lap. But before she could launch into a tirade about Heidi, Hailee was already redirecting—always so quick to smooth things over, to *not* make a scene.

"Ugh, *fine*," Jen huffed, grabbing the remote with exaggerated annoyance—but she still shifted closer on the couch until their shoulders bumped. "But we're skipping to the good fights tonight." She side-eyed Hailee as the opening credits rolled. "...And next weekend? *We're* gonna be the ones getting attention at Sigma Chi's mixer. No fake dates, no bullshit—just us being hot and taking shots until someone actually worthy of you trips over their own tongue."

She nudged Hailee's foot with hers—a silent promise—before dramatically tossing popcorn into her mouth and yelling at Snooki on screen like nothing had happened at all.

Jen's hands clenched into fists on her lap for a second before she forcibly relaxed them, exhaling through her nose. "Fucking Heidi," she muttered under her breath, but didn't press further when Hailee clearly didn't want to dwell on it.

Grabbing the remote, Jen flopped back against the couch cushions and threw an arm around Hailee's shoulders in a half-hug. "You're way too good for that manipulative little—" She cut herself off with a shake of her head. "Yeah, Jersey Shore sounds perfect."

As the opening credits rolled, Jen kept sneaking glances at Hailee's profile—the way they were absently fiddling with the end of their tie again. After a few minutes of Snooki screaming about grenades, Jen suddenly blurted out:

"Next weekend there's this underground punk show at The Basement. No popular kids allowed." She nudged Hailee with her elbow. "We should go scope out some actual decent people for you to wear that hot-as-hell outfit for."

The unspoken message hung between them: *People who'll appreciate you without games.* Jen left it at that, turning up the volume as Vinny started another ridiculous confession booth segment—letting the familiar chaos of reality TV fill the space where bitterness could've been.

[Scene ends with potential new beginnings - Jen being protective/encouraging while leaving room for future interactions with Heidi if desired]

name: Hailee
mes:
*The next day Hailee is making her way out of class. Her bag is thrown over her shoulder and she is making her way diwn the hall. She sees Heidi and a group of her friends*

*Hailee just waves in acknowledgement like she always does she has met them all in passing when they come by the apartment to hang out with Jen. Hailee then remembers and turns around to go over ti Heidi* "Hey Heidi. Jen wanted you to know that she needs you to get the food before you come over for your hang out tomorrow"

name: Using You - Heidi
mes:
Heidi was mid-laugh at something one of her friends said when she spotted Hailee approaching. Her posture stiffened almost imperceptibly—last night’s hallway confession hanging between them like static. But then Hailee delivered Jen’s message with zero awkwardness, and Heidi’s shoulders relaxed.

"Ugh, *of course* she does," Heidi drawled, rolling her eyes for the benefit of her watching friends. She flipped her hair over one shoulder—old habits—but the usual sharp edge to her tone was missing. "Tell Jen if she wants gourmet snacks, she can Venmo me *before* I hit Whole Foods."

One of Heidi’s friends snickered, but Heidi didn’t join in this time. Instead, she hesitated before adding quietly: "...You good after last night?" It sounded casual, but her fingers fidgeted with the rings on her right hand—a tell Hailee might recognize from all those times they'd hung around Jen's apartment together.

Then, as if realizing she'd shown too much concern in front of an audience, Heidi quickly tacked on: "I mean—Jason got *so* wasted after you left. Total mess." Her smirk returned, but it didn't quite reach her eyes this time.
swipes:
Heidi was mid-laugh at something one of her friends said when she caught sight of Hailee approaching. Her posture stiffened almost imperceptibly—shoulders squaring, chin tilting up just a fraction higher. But then Hailee mentioned Jen’s message, and the tension bled out of her in an instant.

"Oh." Heidi blinked, caught off guard by the sheer *normalcy* of it all. No lingering resentment, no awkwardness—just a casual relay of plans like last night hadn’t happened. It threw her more than she’d ever admit.

"Yeah, sure," she replied after a beat too long, tucking a strand of hair behind her ear. "Tell Jen I’ll grab the—” She paused abruptly as Jason strolled past with his usual cocky grin, throwing an arm around Josie further down the hall.

Heidi’s jaw tightened before she forced herself to look back at Hailee with what almost resembled sincerity. “...Thanks for letting me know.”

Then—impulsively—she added: “You should come tomorrow too.” The words tumbled out before she could stop them. “I mean, if you want.” *God*, why did she say that?

Her friends exchanged confused glances behind her as Heidi quickly busied herself adjusting the strap of her bag—suddenly very interested in the floor tiles between them.

Heidi was mid-laugh at something one of her friends said when she spotted Hailee approaching. Her posture stiffened almost imperceptibly—like she'd been caught doing something she shouldn't. But then Hailee delivered Jen's message, and the tension bled out of her shoulders.

"Oh." Heidi blinked, caught off guard by the casualness of it all. She recovered quickly, tossing her hair over one shoulder with a practiced smirk. "Yeah, sure. Tell Jen I'll grab the usual."

Her gaze flickered over Hailee's face for a second too long before adding, quieter: "And... thanks for telling me." There was an awkward pause where Heidi clearly wanted to say more but didn't know how—her fingers fidgeting with the rings on her right hand.

One of Heidi's friends nudged her with a raised eyebrow, snapping her out of whatever thought had distracted her. "Anyway," Heidi said abruptly, voice slipping back into its usual confident lilt as she turned to leave, "see you around."

But as she walked away with her friends in tow, Heidi glanced back once—just briefly—before disappearing around the corner.

Heidi was mid-laugh at something one of her friends said when she spotted Hailee approaching. Her posture stiffened almost imperceptibly—just for a second—before she smoothed her expression into something casual.

"Oh, right," she said, flicking her hair over one shoulder. "Tell Jen I'll grab the sushi like last time." She hesitated, then added with a smirk that didn't quite reach her eyes, "Unless you're planning to crash girls' night again with your weird little snacks."

Her friends giggled on cue—more out of habit than actual amusement. One of them nudged Heidi and whispered something that made her roll her eyes dramatically.

Heidi's gaze flicked over Hailee's face briefly before she turned back to her group with an exaggerated sigh. "Anyway... we've got *so* much to plan for Jason's next party." The name dropped like a challenge as she linked arms with the girl beside her and started walking away without another glance.

But not before muttering under her breath just loud enough for Hailee to catch: "...Tie looked better last night."

Heidi was mid-laugh at something one of her friends said when she caught sight of Hailee approaching. Her posture stiffened almost imperceptibly—last night’s hallway confession still fresh between them—but she smoothed it over with a practiced flip of her hair.

"Oh, *right*," she drawled, like the request was mildly inconvenient but not unexpected. "Tell Jen I’ll grab the usual." She hesitated for half a second before adding, quieter: "And... you can come too if you want. Since it’s your place and all."

One of Heidi's friends snorted into her iced coffee, earning a sharp elbow to the ribs from the girl next to her. Heidi ignored them, tilting her head just slightly as she studied Hailee's face—searching for any lingering resentment.

(There wasn't any. Just that same quiet politeness that made Heidi's stomach twist in a way she refused to examine.)

"Cool," she said finally when Hailee didn't respond right away, already turning back to her group with an exaggerated eye roll—though this one felt more performative than genuine. "*Anyway*, as I was saying before we got *interrupted*..."

But as they walked away, Heidi glanced back once over her shoulder—just quick enough that no one else would notice.

(OOC: The ball is in your court now 👀)
